1.text: The elder to Gaius the beloved, whom I love in truthfulness.

2.text: Beloved, concerning all things I wish that you may prosper and be in health, even as your soul prospers.

3.text: For I rejoiced greatly at the brothers' coming and testifying to your steadfastness in the truth, even as you walk in truth.

4.text: I have no greater joy than these things, that I hear that my children are walking in the truth.

5.text: Beloved, you do faithfully in whatever you have wrought for the brothers, and this for strangers,

6.text: Who testified to your love before the church; whom you will do well to send forward in a manner worthy of God;

7.text: For on behalf of the Name they went out, taking nothing from the Gentiles.

8.text: We therefore ought to support such ones that we may become fellow workers in the truth.

9.text: I wrote something to the church; but Diotrephes, who loves to be first among them, does not receive us.

10.text: For this reason, if I come, I will bring to remembrance his works which he does, babbling against us with evil words; and not being satisfied with these, neither does he himself receive the brothers, and those intending to do so he forbids and casts out of the church.

11.text: Beloved, do not imitate the evil, but the good. He who does good is of God; he who does evil has not seen God.

12.text: To Demetrius testimony has been borne by all and by the truth itself; and we also testify, and you know that our testimony is true.

13.text: I had many things to write to you, but I do not want to write to you with ink and pen;

14.text: But I hope to see you shortly, and we will speak face to face. Peace to you. The friends greet you. Greet the friends by name.
